prompt: <description>Part 1 Instructions Construct a rectangular prism with a slightly tapered top. Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the following parameters: - Euler Angles: -90.0, 0.0, -90.0 - Translation Vector: [0.2253, 0.1033, 0.0] To create the 2D sketch, follow these steps: 1. Draw line 1 from (0, 0) to (0.346, 0) on face 1. 2. Draw line 2 from (0.346, 0) to (0.346, 0.2443) on face 1. 3. Draw line 3 from (0.346, 0.2443) to (0, 0.2443) on face 1. 4. Draw line 4 from (0, 0.2443) to (0, 0) on face 1. This results in a rectangular shape with a width of 0.346, a height of 0.2443, and a length of 0.2253 (the distance between lines 1 and 3). After scaling the 2D sketch by the provided scaling factor, 0.346, proceed to transform the scaled 2D sketch into 3D using the specified Euler angles and translation vector. Extrude the 2D sketch to generate the 3D model of the rectangular prism, using the following parameters: - extrude_depth_towards_normal: 0.0 - extrude_depth_opposite_normal: 0.2253 - sketch_scale: 0.346 The resulting object will have a tapered top due to the extrusion depth difference between the top (towards the normal) and bottom (opposite the normal) surfaces. Part 2 Instructions Construct a CAD model of a rectangular prism with a curved top edge. Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the following parameters: - Euler Angles: -90.0, 0.0, -90.0 - Translation Vector: [0.2253, 0.0147, 0.4549] To create the 2D sketch, follow these steps: 1. Draw arc 1 from (0, 0.1986) to (0.123, 0.2929) with a midpoint at (0.25, 0) on face 1. 2. Draw arc 2 from (0.123, 0.2929) to (0, 0.1986) with a midpoint at (0.0901, 0.2084) on face 1. The resulting shape is a rectangle with curved edges, where both arcs connect with a continuous line to form a single loop. The dimensions are derived from the specified sketch_scale, which applies to both arcs. After scaling the 2D sketch by the provided scaling factor, 0.2929, proceed to transform the scaled 2D sketch into 3D using the specified Euler angles and translation vector. Extrude the 2D sketch to generate the 3D model of the rectangular prism with curved edges, using the following parameters: - extrude_depth_towards_normal: 0.3667 - extrude_depth_opposite_normal: 0.0 - sketch_scale: 0.2929 The final CAD model will be the result of the extrusion process, creating a piece with a curved top edge and a flat bottom.</description>
